page.title: 03HALLATON FARMS AND HOUSES
page.content: Much of the area we are covering is rich agricultural land. The farms are mostly mixed: cereal, sheep or cattle. There is a milk herd of cows in Hallaton and cattle dealers. Some of the land is owned by the Brudenells of Deane Park (near Corby), some by Cambridge colleges and there are a few independent landowners. There is also some Glebe land in Hallaton. The milk herd in Hallaton supplies much of the surrounding area with raw unpasteurised milk. The milk is bott- led on the farm and delivered daily. As well as the farms in the centre of the village, there are many types of houses. These include restored period properties - many thatched, two rows of council houses, 15 charity cottages, other privately rented cottages, and new large executive houses built on infill sites.
